--- format: html --- # THE CoCoaPower PROJECT GROUP---WHO WE ARE ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ::: ::: ::: {.grid} ::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6 .card} ```{=html}

SOPHIE E. STALLASCH, PhD

Email Website ORCID GitHub
``` ::: {.card-body} Sophie is a postdoc at the chair of Quantitative Methods in Educational Sciences at the University of Potsdam. Her dissertation in the context of MULTI-DES focuses on design parameters for student achievement to optimize power analysis for RTs. Apart from experimental design and power analysis, her research interests also cover cognitive and socio-emotional development, multilevel and latent variable modeling, meta-analysis, and R programming. ::: ::: ::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6 .card} ```{=html}

MARTIN BRUNNER, PhD

Email Website ORCID
``` ::: {.card-body} Martin is a full professor and leads the chair of Quantitative Methods in Educational Sciences at the University of Potsdam. His main research interests are cognitive and socio-emotional skills, large-scale assessments, and quantitative methods including integrative data analysis/meta-analysis and multilevel modeling. He has distinguished expertise in various fields of educational research and statistics. As the head of MULTI-DES, he demonstrates long-standing experiences in research design, in particular with regard to design parameters, effect size benchmarks, and power analysis. ::: ::: :::   ::: {.column-screen .full-bleed} ::: {.column-body}
CoCoaPower is funded by Larry V. Hedges through a grant awarded to him
by the [Yidan Prize Foundation](https://yidanprize.org/) in 2018.
```{=html}

LARRY V. HEDGES, PhD

Email Website ORCID
``` Larry is the board of trustees professor of statistics and data science and education and social policy, professor of psychology, professor of medical social sciences, and co-director of the STEPP Center at Northwestern University. He is a world-renowned scholar in statistics and quantitative evaluation research, particularly with respect to research design and power analysis including design parameters, as well as research synthesis/meta-analysis. ::: :::   ::: {.callout-note collapse="true" icon=false} ## {{< bi fingerprint>}} Imprint Sophie E. Stallasch University of Potsdam Department of Educational Sciences Quantitative Methods in Educational Sciences Karl-Liebknecht-Str. 24-25 14476 Potsdam GERMANY Mail: stallasch@uni-potsdam.de :::
